This game once had a decent amount of charm and a lot of fun times to be had, but recently has gone absolutely downhill, and this is mostly due to the negligence of the developers. They have no desire to listen to their community in terms of quality assurance, feedback or constructive criticism. They would much rather "band-aid" the issues with microtransactions than deal with the inherent problems.

Not only does every update lead to a plethora of new issues, this last update may have been the straw that breaks the camel's back. Broken hitboxes, randomly closing lobbies, graphical glitches, errors with the ranking system, and more. A "fix" is apparently coming this week, but I doubt we're going to get a fix for issues that have been going on for years.

If you're new and considering getting into this game, DON'T! This game asks for an extraordinary time sink on your end and quite frankly, it doesn't deserve it.

新手非常难以上手，开始没有血点的时候举步维艰。

所谓的新算法匹配系统就是一坨翔，我一个16级屠夫可以匹配3个最高的红段，溜的人都傻了，毫无游戏体验。

取消了国服原先的连接模式，说是要建立港服，也没个影子。逼着你开加速器，即使开着加速器有没有延迟还得看脸，有时候还会在载入的时候掉线，在结算的时候出错，总之就是白打。

游戏创意很好，很刺激，是个好游戏。感觉不是很为用户的体验考虑。

我作为一个大陆玩家，深受延迟之苦（开了加速器也一样），游戏是好游戏，差评是给运营的，什么时候有好的连接质量了，什么时候改回来
This is what a horror game should feel like. Intense multiplayer thriller action puts four survivors trying to escape from one killer. Easy to learn, hard to master. Very fun!

I've basically stopped playing this game completely after patch 4.5.0 including the new HUD and survivor animations.

The HUD makes the game feel like a mobile game in the fact that they crammed information on every side of the screen, instead of neatly at the bottom like before, I understand that they're giving the player more immediate knowledge which is useful, but they could've made it much more compact and still keeping it at the bottom side of the screen. Second off, nobody really asked for this, it was never a well requested addition or a long time need for the game to improve, BHVR has spent their resources toward something that didn't need changing or much improving.
I'd much rather them change the UI to be more compact and at the bottom of the screen, or be completely reverted.

Regarding the survivor animations, it makes just moving around the map feel incredibly clunky and slow, as well as chases feeling more slow paced and boring, then snappy and quick. BHVR is trying to make a realistic turn for the game which in some cases can be great for certain games, but Dead by Daylight is Goofy and Fun. Might I add that again, literally no one gave a shit if the game felt realistic or not, and no one mentioned that survivors looked terrible when moving.

I hate to say it but, we really didn't fucking ask for these changes. Sorry if I'm a bit harsh here but I probably will not play this game again until the animations feels less clunky or is completely reverted.
I just hope this game falls into my hands again and I can enjoy it as I used to, because this game is amazing, and is super fun with friends, but something needs to change.
Overall I recommend this game and recommend it to anyone looking for an interesting new multiplayer horror game but just know the game wont be scary forever, and I didn't find the game scary after about 40 hours, hope this doesn't paint the game in too bad of a shadow, but this is just my opinion on it for now.

I bought the game recently and unlike most people here to post scathing reviews because of recent updates, I'm just giving my honest opinion about the game.

Which I really like, btw.

For the base price, it's incredibly well made with a lot of interesting content. The game isn't THAT scary, which is nice considering that there's more than a few gameplay mechanics to get familiar with, whether you play as survivor or killer. If scary is what you were after, well, no matter on which side you play, chases get the adrenaline pumping hard. 

Also, if the graphics aren't quite up to your standards and that's holding you back, there's a massive visual update incoming soon. Couldn't ask for more.

You can see for yourself the number of hours. That's saying a lot.

In this game, I'm from the alpha itself. Then the game was generally different, it was easier to stealth, it was impossible to break the generators and at first (as far as I remember) there were no perks as such, they appeared later, I think, in beta.
There was only one maniac (the trapper) and the four first survivors, as well as only a set of Macmillan estate cards. Then the game brought a lot of fun, despite the very small number of players, the first impressions were scary as shit, especially when you first met the insidious perk, when the killer stands still and the sound of terror is not heard, the disguise, so to speak, is very creepy. By the way, I want to give a special greeting to a maniac from alpha meow meow or something like that, if he is Russian and reads this. The most fun for the survivors and the saddest for the maniacs was the rapid movement through the windows (the factory is the perfect map, where you could endlessly run in a circle through the second floor and the maniac could not catch up and hit).

Time passed, the game went into beta, where they added a couple of maniacs (again, if I remember correctly), and then in the release. But there were a lot of bugs on the release, I even wrote a huge post with them, most of them were successfully corrected over time, but here cyberpunk 2077 nervously smokes on the sidelines, given the number of bugs.

In general, they began to add maniacs, survivors, and thus monetize the game. Still add a bunch of "skins" that change only the appearance and do not carry anything new in terms of gameplay. Such an abundance of them is absolutely not necessary, especially for money. It is possible to buy unlicensed maniacs and people for free for points, but they take a long time to accumulate. But the greed of the developers can be seen by the same discounts even on the first DLC, which came out a few years ago (-40%), as well as by the reluctance to add anything new to the game for 4 years. Yes, there is still one mode for repairing 5 generators and escaping through the gate, which is simply polished and refined for 4 years, simultaneously pumping out money for unnecessary skins. Yes, even for participating in the alpha version, I did not get a copy of the game, they gave me only a 10% discount on it.

With regards to the mechanics of something unique here, only the maniacs. The survivors are the same, their perks can be inherited with the achievement of level 40 of the character, which means that the "skin", appearance, simply changes, and anyone can be given perks that are bought in the temple or inherited.
Maniacs do not have this, each has its own characteristics, speed, skills and tactics, for the most part due to this, the game is popular (if you do not take into account the sports gameplay and playing with friends, which makes any game more fun).

Now that the update has been released with a new interface and animations 4.5.0, playing for the maniac has become easier, and for the survivors more difficult, in my opinion. People for the most part do not like change and begin to condemn it, but to each his own. Once upon a time, the hooks could be broken all over the map and the maniac was powerless, and you could jump into the windows almost instantly, whereas the maniac climbed over for a long time, longer than now. But everything is changing and you need to get used to it, giving feedback so that the changes do not lead to a disaster.

The verdict for today: a good multiplayer game, where more interest is achieved by completing the tests that recently appeared in the game and thereby discovering the stories of different characters.
The biggest drawback is the toxic community. I played a lot for maniac and the slang of the local players is "camped" and" tunneled " people. Because I can, because I'm a maniac, no one should tell me how to play, I play as I see fit. Even in the human environment, maniacs are mostly alien to the moral aspects of various issues. But when I played for cannibal, for example, when the saw was still not overheating, and I wanted to torment the players, feeling helpless from the fact that the hanging man could not escape, then after the game I received vile criticism not only in the in-game post-match chat, but also in the Steam profile, on my wall. Of course, I delete the comments, first adding a person to the eternal blacklist (there are already more than 100 people in it and there will be more over time) and calmly play on as I want. You don't have to tell the maniacs how to play, and when I switched to people, I didn't do the same thing, realizing that this is just a game, and that the maniac does what he pleases, I don't blame them.

In general, 7/10.

有在進步

The game is just so bad sometimes. The inconsistency in the game makes it impossible to have a good time for both survivors and killers. The game mechanics themselves makes it impossible to balance the game for new and experienced players as in lower ranks many survivors are at a disadvantage to the lack of map and game mechanic knowledge, while at higher ranks the killers have to deal with ridiculously overpowered survivors and have very little that they can do against them. That mixed with the terrible hit registration leaves you feeling cheated on both sides of the game. And when you start to throw in the massive inconsistencies that take place in game, along with the terrible monetization scheme I can't recommend this game to anyone.

They love changing things nobody even asked for like this poorly mad mobile looking ass UI.

But they keep in all the bugs and poorly designed maps and perks because they have this godlike vision for the game that nobody can even comprehend because as far as I'm concerned, behaviour doesnt even play this game they just base all their updates on Dead By Daylight Funny Moments Montages.

I'm moving onto other things, I keep booting up this bad game out of pure habit when I open steam, but then remember to close it after I come to my sense and realise I'm not going to enjoy myself.

DEAD by daylight? I certainly was. After 47 hours of nonstop playing, i realized the point of the game was to start up generators and not hide the entire game. This lead me to countless games where I was flamed for escaping (it seemed natural to me) without "doing any work". When I play games, i self insert myself into them for realism. I don't know how to fix a generator in real life. In real life I would hide. 

Not too realistic overall.

The developers seriously ignore the people that actually play the game. Imagine putting out a TEST BUILD  and don't read a single review about it and then put out a shit update that fucks the game like seriously. The new survivor movement is a JOKE, the old survivor movement was so perfect and they decide to change it for no reason. Don't even get me started on the desync, as if survivor hit boxes could get an worse. I wish they would just make smart decisions with this game and listen to their community, this game would be so much better. I love this game and I have played over 1000 hours and I can't even play survivor anymore. Such a joke of a game...

Oyunda bir sorunu  halletmeleri aylar sürüyor hitbox lar aşırı saçma match mak.,, sistemi çöp yıllardır kan puanı (oyun için para) sınırını kaldırmaları gerektiğini söylüyor topluluk kaldırılmıyor

yetenekler (perk) karakterlerin açtığınızda başka bir karakterde sahip olamıyorsunuz çünkü kan puanı harcayarak  skill ağacından şansınıza  o kadar perkin arasından çıkarmanız lazım 1. seviye perk olarak bile gelmiyor şansa bağlı.

perklerin seviye sistemi var 1.2.3. bunlara seviye atlatmak ayrı bir sıkıntı

Honestly I really enjoy Dead By Daylight, but I hate Behavior compared to other games of this size and update schedule their updates are laughably sad. They refuse to fix bugs and hit registration that breaks the game, they refuse to nerf and change perks that lead to un fun gameplay mechanics for both sides. In the end this game isnt worth buying right now or porbably ever, it seems the developers of this game have decided that instead of improving the game they wish to juice it for all its worth and leave their core player base in shambles. TLDR Developers are ruining the game and simply dont care do not buy.
